job description:
Our award-winning manufacturing client in the Elkton and Newark area is seeking a talented data analyst to join their time. This position requires the utilization of a variety of reporting applications in order to analyze the operations and manufacturing performance. Analysis will include communicating trends and opportunities for the operations and manufacturing team.

Responsibilities Include:
  • Following SOPs to develop backlog vs. capacity graphs
  • Analyzing and reporting equipment downtime trends
  • Identifying and communicating key trends in manufacturing performance to plan
  • Entering and recording data into systems and spreadsheets
  • Performing additional analyses per the request of the plant operations team
  • Learning Work Space Advanced to generate custom reports
Qualifications:
  • Two year college degree in a technical discipline
  • Ability to think critically and draw conclusions based on data
  • Experienced with Microsoft Office: Excel and Power Point especially
  • Experience learning and using new software applications
Desired Qualifications:
  • Previous experience as a data analyst

    Daily Activities:
  • Backlog and capacity graphs twice per week including qualitative assessment (8-16 hours of work per week)
  • Shipments per month including breakout of planned and last minute/expedited shipments (2 hours per week)
  • Work Space Advanced traning
  • Manufacturing Yields including process and Seam Tape yields (8 hours per week)
  • Down time tracking and analysis (8 hours per week)
Experience:
  • Data Analysis: 1 year (Required)- Microsoft Office: 3 years (Required)

    Education:
  • High school (Required)
